titleStmt.title: John W. Finnell to Nathaniel Gaither, Jr.
CWG8467

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Military Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p:
UNITED WE STAND, DIVIDED WE FALL.
KENTUCKY.
Head-Quarters Kentucky Volunteer Militia,
ADJUTANT GENERAL'S OFFICE,
Frankfort, July 28th 1862.

Hon: Nat Gaither Jr
Sec State --
Capt: Edwin Cook has resigned (date of Com: Octo 24. 1861.)
Lieut: W. W. Sanders promoted (date of Com: Octo 9. 1861.)
Lieut: M H Jenkins promoted (date of Com: Octo 9th 1861.)
Lieut: James M. Givens promoted (date of Com: Octo 9th 1861.)
Lieut: B. S. Tucker promoted (date of Com. Octo 9th 1861)
I send Eight Commissions for Record viz

(Over)
Robert F. Long 2d Lieut: date 23rd Mar 1862 1
Burwell S. Tucker 1st Lieut -- -- -- -- 2
James M. Givens Capt -- -- -- 3
W. B. Riggs -- -- -- 30 Apl -- 4
M. H. Jenkins -- -- -- 1 May -- -- 5
W. W. Sanders -- -- -- 7 June -- 6
John H. Evans_ 2 Lieut -- 28 July -- 7
Wm Miller -- -- -- " -- -- -- 8

Very Resply
John W. Finnell
Adjt Genl
